title: Educational Video Utilization Course for Practice-Based Mathematics Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Offline classroom environments using digital devices (tablets/smartphones). Requires instructional design incorporating video-based education in internet-limited settings

learning_goals: Learners can apply mathematical procedural skills (e.g., statistical analysis, graph interpretation) acquired through video demonstrations to real-world problems with over 85% accuracy.
Learners can improve practical outcomes through peer evaluation feedback referenced from video content, conducted at least three times.
Learners can reduce the time required to complete practical assignments by 20% upon completion of the 4-week course.

resources: Offline Video Storage Device (USB/External Hard Drive)
Basic Mathematics Practice Kit (Graph Paper, Calculator, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
